pageContext.description: A boss-shaped object hammered from one sheet of bronze; badly damaged and apex of cone missing.
pageContext.associations: Leeds Class B 2 bronze cauldron. 17 Socketed Axes; Sheets of Bronze
pageContext.publications: Ant. Journ. XXVIII (1948), pp. 157-163, Fig. 5 and Plate XXIb.,Sussex N. & Queries, Vol. 12, 1, pp. 9-11,and AJ 1957
pageContext.site: England,Sussex,Sompting,Hill Barn Nurseries,Discovered by a mechanical excavator at a point 300 feet north-east of Hill Barn, Sompting and 1,500 feet south0west of the south-west edge of Lancing Ring (TQ176062), October, 1946. Five feet deep in an accumulation of brown clayey mould.
